intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium diaphanoidopsis subsp. volakasense, commonly known as the Volakas hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to the Aegean region of Greece. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, silver-haired leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish composite flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky and dry habitats, often found on coastal cliffs and limestone outcrops. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
